titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives: Miscellaneous Periodicals Collection ALBA.282
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael V. D'Ambrosio, Gail Malmgreen, and Daniel Michelson, 2011

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-12-21T14:47-0500

change.item: Edited by Heather Mulliner to reflect rehousing of collection

did.unittitle: Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives: Miscellaneous Periodicals Collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: This is an open collection of miscellaneous periodicals that relate closely to the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives at New York University; magazines and newspapers in the collection were published in Spain and abroad during the Spanish Civil War and in later years. Although the provenance of many items is unknown, it is clear that some were separated from manuscript collections that form part of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives at the Tamiment Library, NYU; others may have been brought from Spain as souvenirs by Lincoln Brigade members; and some purchased from dealers or given to archives over the years by collectors and others. While some were produced in Spain during the war years and relate directly to the conflict, others may contain only an article or articles on the War and reactions to it around the world. Individual publications in the collection were produced by many publishers and political entities, including a wide array of political and trade-union organizations. The contents of the collection may change over time, as new donations are made. Individual items in the collection have not been catalogued into the main on-line catalogue of New York University. Publications have been set aside for inclusion in this collection for a variety of reasons. Many titles are represented by only one issue; others are in such fragile condition that they may be handled only under the supervision of archives staff; in some cases the items in this collection are duplicate issues of titles that can be found in longer runs in the Library catalogue. To be sure of locating the full range of Spanish Civil War-related periodicals available at the Tamiment Library, researchers should consult both this collection and the main on-line catalogue of Bobst Library, NYU.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English, Spanish, and French with a small amount in Italian and German.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Elmer Holmes Bobst Library
70 Washington Square South
New York, NY 10012
Phone: (212) 998-2630
Fax: (212) 995-4225
E-mail: gail.malmgreen@nyu.edu

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This is an open collection of miscellaneous periodicals that relate closely to the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives at New York University but have not been catalogued into the main on-line catalogue of the University. Publications have been set aside for inclusion in this collection for a variety of reasons. Many titles are represented by only one issue; others are in such fragile condition that they may be handled only under the supervision of archives staff; in some cases the items in this collection are duplicate issues of titles that can be found in longer runs in the Library catalogue. To be sure of locating the full range of Spanish Civil War-related periodicals available at the Tamiment Library, researchers should consult both this collection and the main on-line catalogue of Bobst Library, NYU.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The collection consists of a wide range of periodicals published in Spain and abroad during the Spanish Civil War and in later years. Although the provenance of many items is unknown, it is clear that some were separated from manuscript collections that form part of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives at the Tamiment Library, NYU; others may have been brought from Spain as souvenirs by Lincoln Brigade members; and some purchased from dealers or given to archives over the years by collectors and others. While some were produced in Spain during the war years and relate directly to the conflict, others may contain only an article or articles on the War and reactions to it around the world. Individual publications were produced by many publishers and political entities, including an array of political and trade-union organizations. The contents of this collection may change over time, as new donations are made.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The bulk of the collection came to the Tamiment Library, NYU as part of the original accession of Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives (ALBA) material transferred from Brandeis University in 2001. Some items have been added since, and the collection remains open for additions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
